block.p: MAYTAG CORP., Newton, Iowa, said it would begin selling its appliances at the wholesale warehouse store Sam's Club, a unit of Wal-Mart Stores Inc.

EFAX.COM INC., Menlo Park, Calif., an Internet messaging service company, said its stock had been delisted from the Nasdaq stock market because it no longer met a requirement of $4 million in net tangible assets.
MAYTAG CORP., Newton, Iowa, said it would begin selling its appliances at the wholesale warehouse store Sam's Club, a unit of Wal-Mart Stores Inc.

EFAX.COM INC., Menlo Park, Calif., an Internet messaging service company, said its stock had been delisted from the Nasdaq stock market because it no longer met a requirement of $4 million in net tangible assets.

HAYES LEMMERZ INTERNATIONAL INC., Northville, Mich., a maker of automotive wheels, agreed to buy an aluminum auto-parts foundry in Maulbronn, Germany, to expand its ability to produce lightweight suspension parts. The terms of the deal were not disclosed.

RAYTHEON CO., Vienna, Va., received a U.S. Air Force contract valued at $250 million to provide base operations support at Johnston Atoll, which supports chemical demilitarization activities for the U.S. Army.
